questions.description: When there is a definite past time reference, we use the simple past.

questions.question: Australia …………….. 40% of the world’s known uranium reserves.
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about facts and general truths.

questions.question: Union cabinet ………….. the landmark civilian nuclear co-operation agreement with the USA in March.
questions.description: We use the simple past tense when there is a definite past time reference.

questions.question: A group of students ................. an environmentally friendly Eco One race car.
questions.description: The present perfect is the most common tense for giving news.

questions.question: A powerful earthquake ........................... Japan on July 16 killing and injuring several people.
questions.description: When there is a definite reference to the past, we use the simple past tense.

questions.question: After analyzing thousands of skulls British scientists .......................... at the conclusion that modern humans ...................... from a single point in Africa.
Scientists think they .............................. the energy source of the spectacular colour displays seen in the Northern Lights.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to give news.

questions.question: The world’s oceans which ...................... about a third of the carbon dioxide emitted from burning fossil fuels ...................... more acidic.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about ongoing actions and situations.

questions.question: Babylonians were the first to make New Year resolutions and people all over the world ......................... them ever since.
questions.description: The present perfect and the present perfect continuous tenses are more common with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: During his childhood days, he .................... barefoot deep into the forest to collect firewood.
questions.description: We use would + infinitive to talk about past habits.

questions.question: The world’s oldest city ................... in the deserts of Peru, or so believes a group of archaeologists.
The castle ........................ on the hill for 500 years.
questions.description: The present perfect and the present perfect continuous tenses can both be used to talk about situations that started in the past and have continued up to the present.
